messages.message:
Hi All,
Is there an engineering team who owns our SAML integration?  I am looking to send a client this SAML.pdf but it needs to be updated with the current SAML setup steps. @jean can create a new PDF once we have a technical review of the information.
The PDF is taken from the public documentation here https://instabase.com/docs/reference/administration/authentication/saml-setup/
@Alex Sgueglia  what looks outdated in the docs?

Hi @Heymian, In speaking with @sada my understanding is that the following items in the document are not needed for this SAML setup:

• “the SAML Admin must provide Instabase the metadata file required for authenticating with SAML.”
• “After the prerequisites are set up, configure and rerun your deploy script.”
Also we were looking to get rid of the dogfood link that is in the footer as well as the “External Group Mappings” link since it is not client specific

@Alex Sgueglia that makes sense.  We’ll create a more verbose document for consumption by the customer.  @Heymian we are looking to modifying this document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TCFTSlRgAEUQKyDLtWm9dqdtHW9EFAi2uD81ZYL1MGU/edit#
It does sound there are changes that might need to come through to docs though, yeah, @shaunak?
@jean yes of course.  Once we start cleaning up these documents a bit more, then we will add it to our instabase document repo as well!
ah I see, to move to using control-plane instead of deploy.py.
Yup, I think we’ll need to have both for some time.
@Heymian this is related to the discussion I had with you about patch library, I think we want to move SAML set up to be self service so it doesn’t require our folks to be on a call.
got it, sounds good. will leave this to the control-plane folks then!
Is there someone from the control-plane side that I can follow up with for this document?
